required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020

clinical_study.brief_title: Novel Biomarkers of Preeclampsia, Aquaporin, Fatty Acid, and S110B
clinical_study.official_title: Novel Biomarkers of Preeclampsia: Aquaporin, Fatty Acid, and S100B

brief_summary.textblock: This is a research study designed to help identify preeclampsia in pregnant women earlier, and possibly lead to better treatment for women preeclampsia.

detailed_description.textblock: There is a paucity of biomarkers to predict preeclampsia and for predicting the severity of preeclampsia. This study was designed to identify novel biomarkers for both the prediction of preeclampsia in previously normal pregnancies and for the prediction of the severity of preeclampsia in preeclamptic women. The investigators plan to perform targeted testing for markers that the investigators predict based on their findings or based on available published evidence and the investigators also plan testing for novel markers using various approaches such as proteomics, lipidomics and genomics. The targeted markers will include Aquaporin 4 (AQP4), soluble aquaporin fragments, chemokines, and halogenated fatty acids in the plasma and/or spinal fluid. Aquaporin fragments and AQP4 have been hypothesized to correlate with severe headaches which are complications of severe preeclampsia. The investigators found in their murine studies that there is a correlation between the presence of halogenated fatty acids in the plasma and elevated blood pressure in a murine model of preeclampsia. The approaches will complement the targeted analyses to identify novel markers that have not been predicted yet.

primary_outcome.measure: Aquaporin 4 protein fragments in maternal blood plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Between hospital admission and prior to epidural or combined spinal/epidural anesthesia
primary_outcome.description: The investigators plan to perform targeted testing for markers that the investigators predict based on their findings or based on available published evidence

primary_outcome.measure: S100B protein fragments in maternal blood plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Between hospital admission and prior to epidural or combined spinal/epidural anesthesia
primary_outcome.description: The investigators plan to perform targeted testing for markers that The investigators predict based on their findings or based on available published evidence

primary_outcome.measure: Aquaporin 4 protein fragments in cerebrospinal fluid
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of spinal or combined spinal/epidural anesthesia
primary_outcome.description: The investigators plan to perform targeted testing for markers that the investigators predict based on their findings or based on available published evidence

primary_outcome.measure: S100B protein fragments in cerebrospinal fluid
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of spinal or combined spinal/epidural anesthesia
primary_outcome.description: The investigators plan to perform targeted testing for markers that the investigators predict based on their findings or based on available published evidence

primary_outcome.measure: Aquaporin 4 protein fragments in cord blood and placental samples
primary_outcome.time_frame: Between delivery and 2 hours after delivery
primary_outcome.description: The investigators plan to perform targeted testing for markers that the investigators predict based on their findings or based on available published evidence

primary_outcome.measure: S100B protein fragments in cord blood and placental samples
primary_outcome.time_frame: Between delivery and 2 hours after delivery
primary_outcome.description: The investigators plan to perform targeted testing for markers that the investigators predict based on their findings or based on available published evidence

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between hospital admission and prior to epidural or combined spinal/epidural anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators plan to perform targeted testing for markers that the investigators predict based on their findings or based on available published evidence

secondary_outcome.measure: Fatty acids in cord blood and placental samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between immediately post-delivery and 2 hours after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators plan to perform targeted testing for markers that The investigators predict based on their findings or based on available published evidence

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during epidural or combined spinal/epidural anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators plan to perform targeted testing for markers that The investigators predict based on their findings or based on available published evidence

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women w/ Preeclampsia w/o Visual Disturbances or Headache
arm_group.description: Preeclampsia Without either Visual Disturbances or Headaches Blood Pressure: >Systolic 160 or Diastolic 110

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women w/ Preeclampsia w/ Visual Disturbances or Headaches
arm_group.description: Preeclampsia With either Visual Disturbances or Headaches Blood Pressure: >Systolic 160 or Diastolic 110

intervention.intervention_name: Women w/ Preeclampsia w/o Visual Disturbances or Headache
intervention.description: Up to three maternal blood samples collected from each participant, cerebrospinal fluid collected from each participant during spinal or combined spinal/epidural anesthesia, one umbilical cord blood sample obtained from each participant, four placenta samples obtained from each placenta from each participant
intervention.arm_group_label: Women w/ Preeclampsia w/o Visual Disturbances or Headache

intervention.intervention_name: Women w/ Preeclampsia w/ Visual Disturbances or Headaches
intervention.description: Up to three maternal blood samples collected from each participant, cerebrospinal fluid collected from each participant during spinal or combined spinal/epidural anesthesia, one umbilical cord blood sample obtained from each participant, four placenta samples obtained from each placenta from each participant
intervention.arm_group_label: Women w/ Preeclampsia w/ Visual Disturbances or Headaches

intervention.description: Up to three maternal blood samples collected from each participant, cerebrospinal fluid collected from each participant during spinal or combined spinal/epidural anesthesia, one umbilical cord blood sample obtained from each participant, four placenta samples obtained from each placenta from each participant

study_pop.textblock: Women older than 20 years of age, who meet all inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria, and who are willing and able to sign informed consent documentation, as well as receive a combined spinal/epidural, or a spinal anesthesia regimen.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Greater than or equal to 20 years of age
- Greater than 24 weeks of gestation
- Obstetrics/Anesthesia Team had decided that Combined Spinal/Epidural (CSE) or Spinal Anesthesia will be performed
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-pregnancy comorbidities:
- hypertension, diabetes, or pulmonary hypertension
- use of steroids, beta blockers, Ca channel antagonist, anticoagulants
- cardiac or vascular conditions
- severe headaches or visual disturbances
- Inability to receive CSE or Spinal Anesthesia
- Chorioamnionitis, fever, bronchitis, pneumonia
